newsitem.title: FRANCE: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde Dec 31.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde Dec 31.

text.p: These are leading stories in today's afternoon daily Le Monde, dated Jan 1.

-- President Jacques Chirac expected to tell the nation on Tuesday evening he is confident his policy will put the nation in a position to honour its commitments to the single currency on January 1, 1999.

-- France Telecom, a private limited company as of December 31, faces major challenges in terms of management style, restructuring, training and corporate culture in the run-up to deregulation of the telecoms market in early 1998.

-- CMA press release after board meeting notes financial disagreement over purchase of state-owned CGM shipping company, but adds "concessions have been made to encourage an accord". The CFDT trade union at its December 17 meeting called on crews to strike.
-- Air Liberte founder Lotfi Belhassine has resigned from the board and turned over the chair to Marc Rochet.
